title: Alienware's latest peripherals have landed, but the monitor might be overkill
description: Two new hi-res gaming headsets, a wireless mouse, Alienware's first-ever wireless gaming keyboard, and the world's first 500Hz IPS monitor joins the manufacturer's growing gaming peripherals line.

title: Major new crypto wallet phishing campaign targets Trezor users
description: Trezor users are being scared into giving away their seed phrases, which crooks can use to clear out their accounts.

title: Your Ring camera features are about to change, and not in a good way
description: Future purchases of the Ring Alarm system will also lock key features away requiring users to purchase a Ring Protect Plan.

title: These are reportedly the best tools for new businesses - how does your firm shape up?
description: The team behind Adobe Acrobat has curated its selection of the best tools to take your business to the digital max.

title: Bot malware could be the next big security risk for you to worry about
description: Swiping entire user profiles is a huge risk, as they can be used to bypass MFA.

title: Aruba says it has patched a number of critical security flaws, so update now
description: A number of Aruba products are being patched to keep users safe.

title: CCleaner's VPN gets faster and more secure
description: Kamo's Private Connection adds WireGuard as default protocol, allowing users "to take more ownership and control over their digital lives."

title: Microsoft launches a Mandalorian Xbox Series X and you can't buy it
description: Microsoft has launched Xbox Series X and Series S consoles based on the Mandalorian show, and they can't be bought.

title: Google Cloud storage may not be as secure as we'd all hope it is
description: Logs are every investigator's best friend but with GCP, they're not as good as they could be, researchers claim.

title: Sony's selling so many PS5s it's become AMD's biggest GPU buyer
description: Sony has become one of AMD’s biggest historic backers thanks to the PS5’s continued market dominance.

title: A judge is making Sony reveal its PS5 exclusivity deals to Microsoft
description: The FTC has upheld parts of Microsoft’s subpoena of Sony’s confidential documents while quashing other, weirder requests.

title: This dangerous UEFI bootkit can hijack your Windows PC with ease
description: It bypasses Windows antivirus protections and can deploy other malicious threats.

title: Xiaomi could finally be making a true rival to the Galaxy Watch and Pixel Watch
description: The Chinese tech giant appears to be lining up a wearable that runs Google’s Wear OS 3 – and that could be a great combo.

title: This Photoshop alternative for Mac now lets you remove colors easily
description: Pixelmator Pro launches v3.3 - and introduces some top tools and color adjustments for editing images and videos.

title: 300TB SSD are coming soon, but they will be shockingly expensive
description: Pure Storage expects to sell 300TB Flash modules by 2026.

title: Android 14 might get rid of passwords for good
description: Android 14 will let third-party apps take care of your passkeys, with Dashlane pledging its support.

title: The first PCIe 5.0 SSDs are here, but you really don't want to buy one yet
description: The PCIe 5.0 connection is nothing new, but there are now purpose-built SSDs to fit it. But, you shouldn’t get one.

title: Apple now pays more for some old iPhones, but you can do much better
description: Apple has increased the trade-in prices of some of its latest iPhones, but alternative options are better value.

title: Windows 11’s ChatGPT-powered Bing AI taskbar is nothing more than a pointless ad
description: Microsoft has put Bing AI onto everyone's taskbar but we have to ask, what’s the point?

title: Fujifilm INSTAX MINI 12 – successor to the best instant camera for beginners – has landed
description: The Fujifilm INSTAX MINI 12 is the successor to the best instant camera for beginners and brings a key new feature that will make composing your shots easier

title: GitHub can now tell you if you ever leak any secrets in your code
description: GitHub will let users know if they expose details such as passwords and API keys in any public repo for free.

title: Star Wars Jedi: Survivor director wants a full-on trilogy
description: Star Wars Jedi: Survivor director Stig Asmussen uses an interview to hint at plans for a third title.

title: Just Dance is an Olympic sport now all the good games have been taken
description: Esports will be present at the Olympics for a second time with some interesting titles set to make their debut.

title: Garmin Forerunner 265 and 965 announced with new AMOLED screens – but not much else
description: The Garmin Forerunner 965 and 265 are here with a revamped AMOLED screen and a redesigned 'run' button, less than a year after their predecessors.

title: Microsoft Teams wants to take your Excel game to the next level
description: Collaborate on your Excel sheets live on a Microsoft Teams call.

title: The Ninja Woodfire is like an outdoor air fryer, and I've seen what else it can do
description: The Ninja Woodfire makes it possible to cook how you want, wherever you want it, with seven really useful settings.

title: Fed up with the Bing AI chatbot’s attitude? Now you can change its personality
description: With three selections for different personalities possible, there seems to be a clear favorite so far.

title: There's now an official ChatGPT API for businesses to join the fun
description: OpenAI expands ChatGPT monetization with enterprise API launch.

title: Motorola Razr 2023 confirmed to be coming soon, and will apparently be a big upgrade
description: Lenovo's CEO has confirmed that the next Motorola Razr is coming "very soon", as well as hinting at some improvements.

title: Your SaaS setup could be a major security risk to your business
description: Report highlights how third parties, business leaders, and employees could all be exposing data.

title: Microsoft Teams is going to use green screen technology to make your video calls better
description: Virtual backgrounds are accessible to the masses, but there’s only one way to get them to look any good.

title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Thursday, March 2 (game #402)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Just when we thought we were safe, ChatGPT is coming for our graphics cards
description: With the rise of ChatGPT and large language models, should gamers worry about a repeat of the cryptocurrency-driven GPU shortage of the past couple of years?

title: Oh dear, Windows 12 might have just been leaked...by Microsoft and Intel
description: An internal report from Intel may have revealed that Windows 12 is coming soon, and could support Intel's next-gen CPU.
